jalape\u00f1o.name: Jalapeño
jalape\u00f1o.effect: A very spicy ingredient—so spicy as to leave no room for ambivalence about it. You either like it or you don’t.

jam.name: Jam
jam.effect: A condiment that’s very sweet and likewise very sour. Take care when adding it to sandwiches, as the sweet side can overwhelm.

johtoslate.name: Johto Slate
johtoslate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Johto Room at Ramanas Park.

jollymint.name: Jolly Mint
jollymint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Jolly nature.

kangaskhanite.name: Kangaskhanite
kangaskhanite.effect: Enables Kangaskhan to Mega Evolve during battle.

kantoslate.name: Kanto Slate
kantoslate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Kanto Room at Ramanas Park.

kasibberry.name: Kasib Berry
kasibberry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Ghost-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

kebiaberry.name: Kebia Berry
kebiaberry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Poison-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

keeberry.name: Kee Berry
keeberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the holder's Defense if it's hit with a physical move.

kelpsyberry.name: Kelpsy Berry
kelpsyberry.effect: Increases Friendship but lowers Attack EVs.

ketchup.name: Ketchup
ketchup.effect: A condiment with very salty and tart flavor. While a number of other ingredients go into its signature flavor, the noble tomato is its heart and soul.

king'srock.name: King's Rock
king'srock.effect: May cause opponent to flinch. Evolves Poliwhirl and Slowpoke when traded holding the item.

kiwi.name: Kiwi
kiwi.effect: A very tart ingredient that has a light touch of sweetness as well. It goes well with rich ingredients.

klawfclaw.name: Klawf Claw
klawfclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Klawf, used in TM crafting.

klawfstick.name: Klawf Stick
klawfstick.effect: A very sweet and salty ingredient. It’s a nutritious processed food made with a concentrate derived from shed Klawf shells.

klefkikey.name: Klefki Key
klefkikey.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Klefki, used in TM crafting.

kofu'swallet.name: Kofu's Wallet
kofu'swallet.effect: A wallet that was left behind by Kofu, the Gym Leader at the Cascarrafa Gym. You’re to deliver it to him at the market in Porto Marinada.

komalaclaw.name: Komala Claw
komalaclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Komala, used in TM crafting.

kommoniumz.name: Kommonium Z
kommoniumz.effect: Allows Kommo-o to upgrade Clanging Scales to a Z-Move, Clangorous Soulblaze.

koraidon'spok\u00e9ball.name: Koraidon's Poké Ball
koraidon'spok\u00e9ball.effect: A Poké Ball that can hold the mysterious Pokémon known as Koraidon. A boy named Arven gave it to you.

kricketotshell.name: Kricketot Shell
kricketotshell.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Kricketot, used in TM crafting.

lansatberry.name: Lansat Berry
lansatberry.effect: Increases critical-hit ratio when HP is low.

largeleek.name: Large Leek
largeleek.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. Whether this is the kind of vegetable stalk that Farfetch’d like is unknown.

larvestafuzz.name: Larvesta Fuzz
larvestafuzz.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Larvesta, used in TM crafting.

larvitarclaw.name: Larvitar Claw
larvitarclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Larvitar, used in TM crafting.

latiasite.name: Latiasite
latiasite.effect: Enables Latias to Mega Evolve during battle.

latiosite.name: Latiosite
latiosite.effect: Enables Latios to Mega Evolve during battle.

laxincense.name: Lax Incense
laxincense.effect: Lowers the opponent's accuracy. Breeding Wobbuffet produces Wynaut when held.

laxmint.name: Lax Mint
laxmint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Lax nature.

leader'screst.name: Leader's Crest
leader'screst.effect: A shard of what appears to be an old blade of some sort. It is held only by Bisharp that head up a group of Pawniard.

leafletter.name: Leaf Letter
leafletter.effect: A letter written on a leaf. Something is written using Eevee's footprints.

leafytablecloth.name: Leafy Tablecloth
leafytablecloth.effect: A botanically themed tablecloth featuring Grass-type Pokémon. Can you find the Pokémon that doesn’t quite fit in?

lechonkhair.name: Lechonk Hair
lechonkhair.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Lechonk, used in TM crafting.

leek.name: Leek
leek.effect: Increases critical-hit ratio when held by Farfetch'd.

leftovers.name: Leftovers
leftovers.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's HP is gradually restored during battle.

leppaberry.name: Leppa Berry
leppaberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, it restores a move's PP by 10.

lettuce.name: Lettuce
lettuce.effect: This bitter-tasting ingredient is simple and straightforward—just add it to all kinds of other ingredients for a delightfully crunchy time.

levelball.name: Level Ball
levelball.effect: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are a lower level than your own.

liechiberry.name: Liechi Berry
liechiberry.effect: Raises Attack when HP is low.

lifeorb.name: Life Orb
lifeorb.effect: Increases the power of moves, but loses HP each turn.

lightball.name: Light Ball
lightball.effect: An item to be held by PIKACHU. It is a puzzling orb that raises the Attack and Sp. Atk stat.

lightclay.name: Light Clay
lightclay.effect: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of barrier moves like Light Screen and Reflect used by the holder.

lilactablecloth.name: Lilac Tablecloth
lilactablecloth.effect: A light purple tablecloth. It’s smooth and pleasant to the touch, and dishes can be placed on it with hardly a sound.

linkingcord.name: Linking Cord
linkingcord.effect: A string exuding a mysterious energy that makes you feel a strange sense of connection. It’s loved by certain Pokémon.

litleotuft.name: Litleo Tuft
litleotuft.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Litleo, used in TM crafting.

loadeddice.name: Loaded Dice
loadeddice.effect: Makes multi-strike moves more likely to hit more times.

lonelymint.name: Lonely Mint
lonelymint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Lonely nature.

lookerticket.name: Looker Ticket
lookerticket.effect: A ticket that was handmade by Looker. It's decorated with a liberal amount of glittery paint.

lopunnite.name: Lopunnite
lopunnite.effect: Enables Lopunny to Mega Evolve during battle.

loveball.name: Love Ball
loveball.effect: Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that are the opposite gender of your Pokémon.

lovesweet.name: Love Sweet
lovesweet.effect: Evolves Milcery into Heart Flavor Alcremie.

lucarionite.name: Lucarionite
lucarionite.effect: Enables Lucario to Mega Evolve during battle.

luckincense.name: Luck Incense
luckincense.effect: Doubles prize money if held. Breeding Chansey or Blissey produces Happiny when held.

luckyegg.name: Lucky Egg
luckyegg.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is an egg filled with happiness that earns extra Exp. Points in battle.

luckypunch.name: Lucky Punch
luckypunch.effect: Increases critical-hit ratio when held by Chansey.

lumberry.name: Lum Berry
lumberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, it recovers from any status problem.

luminousmoss.name: Luminous Moss
luminousmoss.effect: Raises Special Defense if hit by a Water-type move.

lunaliumz.name: Lunalium Z
lunaliumz.effect: Allows Lunala to upgrade Moongeist Beam to a Z-Move, Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom.

lureball.name: Lure Ball
lureball.effect: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon hooked by a Rod when fishing.

lustrousorb.name: Lustrous Orb
lustrousorb.effect: Increases the power of Dragon- and Water-type moves when held by Palkia.

luvdiscscales.name: Luvdisc Scales
luvdiscscales.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Luvdisc, used in TM crafting.

luxuryball.name: Luxury Ball
luxuryball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon and increases their friendship more quickly.

lycaniumz.name: Lycanium Z
lycaniumz.effect: Allows Lycanroc to upgrade Stone Edge to a Z-Move, Splintered Stormshards.

machobrace.name: Macho Brace
machobrace.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a stiff and heavy brace that promotes strong growth but lowers Speed.

magicalheartpick.name: Magical Heart Pick
magicalheartpick.effect: A pick shaped after a magic wand. Perhaps the real magic is the food maker’s wish for a delicious dish.

magicalstarpick.name: Magical Star Pick
magicalstarpick.effect: A pick shaped after a magic wand. Perhaps the real magic is the food maker’s wish for a delicious dish.

magikarpscales.name: Magikarp Scales
magikarpscales.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Magikarp, used in TM crafting.

magmarizer.name: Magmarizer
magmarizer.effect: Evolves Magmar when traded holding the item.

magnemitescrew.name: Magnemite Screw
magnemitescrew.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Magnemite, used in TM crafting.

magnet.name: Magnet
magnet.effect: Increases the power of Electric-type moves.

magoberry.name: Mago Berry
magoberry.effect: Restores HP if it's low, but may cause confusion.

magostberry.name: Magost Berry
magostberry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

makuhitasweat.name: Makuhita Sweat
makuhitasweat.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Makuhita, used in TM crafting.

manectite.name: Manectite
manectite.effect: Enables Manectric to Mega Evolve during battle.

mankeyfur.name: Mankey Fur
mankeyfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Mankey, used in TM crafting.

marangaberry.name: Maranga Berry
marangaberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the holder's Sp. Def if it's hit with a special move.

mareaniespike.name: Mareanie Spike
mareaniespike.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Mareanie, used in TM crafting.

mareepwool.name: Mareep Wool
mareepwool.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Mareep, used in TM crafting.

marillball.name: Marill Ball
marillball.effect: A Marill-themed ball. It’s soft and springy. Make sure you haven’t mistaken a real Marill for this ball before throwing.

marmalade.name: Marmalade
marmalade.effect: A condiment with sour and bitter notes. It’s surprisingly useful, as it makes a nice counterpoint to oilier foods.

marshadiumz.name: Marshadium Z
marshadiumz.effect: Allows Marshadow to upgrade Spectral Thief to a Z-Move, Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike.

maschifffang.name: Maschiff Fang
maschifffang.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Maschiff, used in TM crafting.

masterball.name: Master Ball
masterball.effect: Catches any wild Pokémon without fail.

mawilite.name: Mawilite
mawilite.effect: Enables Mawile to Mega Evolve during battle.

maxelixir.name: Max Elixir
maxelixir.effect: Fully restores PP to all moves of a Pokémon.

maxether.name: Max Ether
maxether.effect: Fully restores PP to one move of a Pokémon.

maxrepel.name: Max Repel
maxrepel.effect: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 250 steps after its use.

maxrevive.name: Max Revive
maxrevive.effect: Revives a fainted Pokémon, fully restoring its HP.

mayonnaise.name: Mayonnaise
mayonnaise.effect: A condiment that packs a very tart punch yet pairs well with various ingredients.

meadowplate.name: Meadow Plate
meadowplate.effect: Increases power of Grass-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Grass.

medichamite.name: Medichamite
medichamite.effect: Enables Medicham to Mega Evolve during battle.

medititesweat.name: Meditite Sweat
medititesweat.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Meditite, used in TM crafting.

mentalherb.name: Mental Herb
mentalherb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It snaps the holder out of infatuation. It can be used only once.

meowthfur.name: Meowth Fur
meowthfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Meowth, used in TM crafting.

metagrossite.name: Metagrossite
metagrossite.effect: Enables Metagross to Mega Evolve during battle.

metalcoat.name: Metal Coat
metalcoat.effect: Increases the power of Steel-type moves. Evolves Onix and Scyther when traded holding the item.

metalpowder.name: Metal Powder
metalpowder.effect: Increases Defense when held by Ditto.

metronome.name: Metronome
metronome.effect: Increases the power of moves used consecutively.

mewniumz.name: Mewnium Z
mewniumz.effect: Allows Mew to upgrade Psychic to a Z-Move, Genesis Supernova.

mewtwonitex.name: Mewtwonite X
mewtwonitex.effect: Enables Mewtwo to Mega Evolve during battle.

mewtwonitey.name: Mewtwonite Y
mewtwonitey.effect: Enables Mewtwo to Mega Evolve during battle.

micleberry.name: Micle Berry
micleberry.effect: Increases a move's accuracy when HP is low.

mightycandy.name: Mighty Candy
mightycandy.effect: Increases a Pokémon's Attack stat by 1.

mildmint.name: Mild Mint
mildmint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Mild nature.

mimikiumz.name: Mimikium Z
mimikiumz.effect: Allows Mimikyu to upgrade Play Rough to a Z-Move, Let's Snuggle Forever.

mimikyuscrap.name: Mimikyu Scrap
mimikyuscrap.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Mimikyu, used in TM crafting.

mindplate.name: Mind Plate
mindplate.effect: Increases power of Psychic-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Psychic.

minttablecloth.name: Mint Tablecloth
minttablecloth.effect: A light mint-colored tablecloth. It’s smooth and pleasant to the touch, and dishes can be placed on it with hardly a sound.

miracleseed.name: Miracle Seed
miracleseed.effect: Increases the power of Grass-type moves.

miraidon'spok\u00e9ball.name: Miraidon's Poké Ball
miraidon'spok\u00e9ball.effect: A Poké Ball that can hold the mysterious Pokémon known as Miraidon. A boy named Arven gave it to you.

mirrorherb.name: Mirror Herb
mirrorherb.effect: Copies an opponent's stat increases when consumed.

misdreavustears.name: Misdreavus Tears
misdreavustears.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Misdreavus, used in TM crafting.

mistyseed.name: Misty Seed
mistyseed.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Misty Terrain. It can only be used once.

mixedmushrooms.name: Mixed Mushrooms
mixedmushrooms.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. The chewy texture of the mushrooms transforms any dish they’re added to.

modestmint.name: Modest Mint
modestmint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Modest nature.

monstroustablecloth.name: Monstrous Tablecloth
monstroustablecloth.effect: A tablecloth designed by the Pewter Museum of Science. The academic air of the pattern is a big hit with kids and adults alike.

moomoocheese.name: Moomoo Cheese
moomoocheese.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. Melted cheese can really give a curry some richness.

moonball.name: Moon Ball
moonball.effect: A Poké Ball for catching Pokémon that evolve using the Moon Stone.

mudbraymud.name: Mudbray Mud
mudbraymud.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Mudbray, used in TM crafting.

murkrowbauble.name: Murkrow Bauble
murkrowbauble.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Murkrow, used in TM crafting.

muscleband.name: Muscle Band
muscleband.effect: Increases the power of Physical-category moves.

mustard.name: Mustard
mustard.effect: A very spicy condiment that’s indispensable when bread is on the table. It pairs tremendously with ketchup.

mysteriousshardl.name: Mysterious Shard L
mysteriousshardl.effect: A large shard that emanates an enigmatic power. Inside the shard, you can see a pattern that looks like Ramanas roses.

mysteriousshards.name: Mysterious Shard S
mysteriousshards.effect: A small shard that emanates an enigmatic power. Inside the shard, you can see a pattern that looks like Ramanas roses.

mysticwater.name: Mystic Water
mysticwater.effect: Increases the power of Water-type moves.

naclisalt.name: Nacli Salt
naclisalt.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Nacli, used in TM crafting.

naivemint.name: Naive Mint
naivemint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Naive nature.

nanabberry.name: Nanab Berry
nanabberry.effect: A Berry to be used in cooking. Calms a Pokémon in battle, in Let's Go Pikachu/Eevee.

naughtymint.name: Naughty Mint
naughtymint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Naughty nature.

nestball.name: Nest Ball
nestball.effect: Catches lower level wild Pokémon with a higher rate (up to 4x for level 1).

netball.name: Net Ball
netball.effect: Catches Water- and Bug-type Pokémon with 3.5x the rate of a standard Poké Ball.

never-meltice.name: Never-Melt Ice
never-meltice.effect: Increases the power of Ice-type moves.

noibatfur.name: Noibat Fur
noibatfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Noibat, used in TM crafting.

nomelberry.name: Nomel Berry
nomelberry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

noodles.name: Noodles
noodles.effect: A nice salty ingredient. It’s unclear how well these boiled noodles will serve as a sandwich filling.

normalgem.name: Normal Gem
normalgem.effect: Increases the power of a Normal-type move only once.

normalterashard.name: Normal Tera Shard
normalterashard.effect: Changes a Pokémon's Tera Type to Normal.

normaliumz.name: Normalium Z
normaliumz.effect: Allows the use of Breakneck Blitz, the Normal type Z-Move.

nugget.name: Nugget
nugget.effect: A nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous gleam. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

numellava.name: Numel Lava
numellava.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Numel, used in TM crafting.

nymbleclaw.name: Nymble Claw
nymbleclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Nymble, used in TM crafting.

occaberry.name: Occa Berry
occaberry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Fire-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

oceanicslate.name: Oceanic Slate
oceanicslate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Oceanic Room at Ramanas Park.

oddincense.name: Odd Incense
oddincense.effect: Increases the power of Psychic-type moves. Breeding Mr. Mime produces Mime Jr. when held.

oddkeystone.name: Odd Keystone
oddkeystone.effect: A vital item that is needed to keep a stone tower from collapsing. Voices can be heard from it occasionally.

oldamber.name: Old Amber
oldamber.effect: A piece of amber that contains the genetic material of an ancient Pokémon. It is clear with a reddish tint.

oliveoil.name: Olive Oil
oliveoil.effect: A condiment offering faint notes of sour and bitter flavors. The most prized varieties are the ones Smoliv love the smell of—such oils’ quality is assured.

onion.name: Onion
onion.effect: This spicy veggie is indispensable to many sandwiches. It goes well with rich ingredients.

oranberry.name: Oran Berry
oranberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, it heals the user by just 10 HP.

orangedish.name: Orange Dish
orangedish.effect: A dish for picnics. Comes in plenty of colors to choose from based on the food or the mood. The orange variety is the most popular of all.

orangurufur.name: Oranguru Fur
orangurufur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Oranguru, used in TM crafting.

oricoriofeather.name: Oricorio Feather
oricoriofeather.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Oricorio, used in TM crafting.

orthwormtarnish.name: Orthworm Tarnish
orthwormtarnish.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Orthworm, used in TM crafting.

ovalcharm.name: Oval Charm
ovalcharm.effect: An oval charm said to increase the chance of Pokémon Eggs being found at the Day Care.

pachirisufur.name: Pachirisu Fur
pachirisufur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Pachirisu, used in TM crafting.

packofpotatoes.name: Pack of Potatoes
packofpotatoes.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. Potatoes help mellow out a spicy taste, to make a dish more mild.

packagedcurry.name: Packaged Curry
packagedcurry.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. Using packaged curry helps make sure there are no slipups when cooking.

pamtreberry.name: Pamtre Berry
pamtreberry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

parasolpick.name: Parasol Pick
parasolpick.effect: Some complain that the parasol part of this pick is hard to hold on to, so your fingers get messy. Still, it’s fun to twirl this all around after you’ve eaten.

parkball.name: Park Ball
parkball.effect: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.

partysparklerpick.name: Party Sparkler Pick
partysparklerpick.effect: This pick features a small sparkler that goes off automatically. It’s used at parties or for guests of honor. It leaves an oddly appealing aroma once it’s burned out.

passorb.name: Pass Orb
passorb.effect: A mysterious orb containing the power of the Unova region, to be used when generating Pass Power.

passhoberry.name: Passho Berry
passhoberry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Water-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

passimianfur.name: Passimian Fur
passimianfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Passimian, used in TM crafting.

pasta.name: Pasta
pasta.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. These flour noodles make for a surprisingly good match with curry.

pawmifur.name: Pawmi Fur
pawmifur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Pawmi, used in TM crafting.

pawniardblade.name: Pawniard Blade
pawniardblade.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Pawniard, used in TM crafting.

payapaberry.name: Payapa Berry
payapaberry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Psychic-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

peachtablecloth.name: Peach Tablecloth
peachtablecloth.effect: A light peach-colored tablecloth. It’s smooth and pleasant to the touch, and dishes can be placed on it with hardly a sound.

peanutbutter.name: Peanut Butter
peanutbutter.effect: A very sweet condiment. People in Paldea seem to favor the sweet varieties over the unsweetened.

pearl.name: Pearl
pearl.effect: A somewhat-small pearl that sparkles in a pretty silver color. It can be sold cheaply to shops.

pearlstring.name: Pearl String
pearlstring.effect: Very large pearls that sparkle in a pretty silver color. A maniac will buy them for a high price.

peatblock.name: Peat Block
peatblock.effect: A block of muddy material that can be used as fuel for burning when it is dried. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

pechaberry.name: Pecha Berry
pechaberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, it recovers from poison.

pepper.name: Pepper
pepper.effect: A seasoning packing very spicy flavor. It goes nicely with oilier foods and works especially well when you add just a pinch for a hint of flavor.

permit.name: Permit
permit.effect: A permit that is needed to enter the Nature Preserve. Not many know about it.

persimberry.name: Persim Berry
persimberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, it recovers from confusion.

petayaberry.name: Petaya Berry
petayaberry.effect: Raises Special Attack when HP is low.

petililleaf.name: Petilil Leaf
petililleaf.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Petilil, used in TM crafting.

phanpynail.name: Phanpy Nail
phanpynail.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Phanpy, used in TM crafting.

pichufur.name: Pichu Fur
pichufur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Pichu, used in TM crafting.

pickle.name: Pickle
pickle.effect: This very sour ingredient is made by pickling veggies in a flavorful brine made from spices and vinegar.

picnicset.name: Picnic Set
picnicset.effect: A roomy basket packed with all sorts of things for use when enjoying picnicking with your Pokémon.

pidgeotite.name: Pidgeotite
pidgeotite.effect: Enables Pidgeot to Mega Evolve during battle.

pika-pikapick.name: Pika-Pika Pick
pika-pikapick.effect: A Pick-achu, as it were, sporting Pikachu’s usual expression. It’s easy to grab by the ears, which is part of why it’s so popular.

pikachucup.name: Pikachu Cup
pikachucup.effect: A cup for big-time Pokémon fans. Kids will happily drink out of it, making it a boon to parents.

pikaniumz.name: Pikanium Z
pikaniumz.effect: Allows Pikachu to upgrade Volt Tackle to a Z-Move, Catastropika.

pikashuniumz.name: Pikashunium Z
pikashuniumz.effect: Allows Pikachu in a cap to upgrade Thunderbolt to a Z-Move, 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt.

pinapberry.name: Pinap Berry
pinapberry.effect: A Berry to be used in cooking. Increases chances of getting items when a Pokémon is caught, in Pokémon Let's Go.

pincurchinspines.name: Pincurchin Spines
pincurchinspines.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Pincurchin, used in TM crafting.

pineapple.name: Pineapple
pineapple.effect: This very tart ingredient is a fruit of southern lands, and its color and texture are a thrill. It’s been cut into chunks to be easily manageable.

pinecohusk.name: Pineco Husk
pinecohusk.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Pineco, used in TM crafting.

pinkapricorn.name: Pink Apricorn
pinkapricorn.effect: A pink Apricorn. It has a nice, sweet scent.

pinkbottle.name: Pink Bottle
pinkbottle.effect: A go-to bottle widely used for drinks at picnics. Its simple design and portability make it popular among all sorts of people.

pinkcup.name: Pink Cup
pinkcup.effect: A cup sold with the Pink Bottle. The two don’t stack, so they’re tough to pack—but they look good, so they’re popular with those who like to post picnic photos.

pinknectar.name: Pink Nectar
pinknectar.effect: The flower nectar obtained at the flowering shrubs on Royal Avenue. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

pinkscarf.name: Pink Scarf
pinkscarf.effect: Raises holder's Cute aspect in a Contest.

pinktablecloth.name: Pink Tablecloth
pinktablecloth.effect: A simple pink tablecloth. It’s smooth and pleasant to the touch, and dishes can be placed on it with hardly a sound.

pinsirite.name: Pinsirite
pinsirite.effect: Enables Pinsir to Mega Evolve during battle.

pixieplate.name: Pixie Plate
pixieplate.effect: Increases power of Fairy-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Fairy.

plaidtablecloth(b).name: Plaid Tablecloth (B)
plaidtablecloth(b).effect: A sturdy tablecloth made of thick fabric. The gentle blue plaid gives a table a crisp look.

plaidtablecloth(r).name: Plaid Tablecloth (R)
plaidtablecloth(r).effect: A sturdy tablecloth made of thick fabric. The quietly composed red plaid gives the table some flair.

plaidtablecloth(y).name: Plaid Tablecloth (Y)
plaidtablecloth(y).effect: A sturdy tablecloth made of thick fabric. The cheery yellow plaid brightens up a table.

plasmacard.name: Plasma Card
plasmacard.effect: A card key needed to enter the password inside the Plasma Frigate.

plumefossil.name: Plume Fossil
plumefossil.effect: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that flew in the sky in ancient times. It appears to be part of its wing.

poisonbarb.name: Poison Barb
poisonbarb.effect: Increases the power of Poison-type moves.

poisongem.name: Poison Gem
poisongem.effect: Increases the power of a Poison-type move only once.

poisonmemory.name: Poison Memory
poisonmemory.effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Poison type.

poisonterashard.name: Poison Tera Shard
poisonterashard.effect: Changes a Pokémon's Tera Type to Poison.

poisoniumz.name: Poisonium Z
poisoniumz.effect: Allows the use of Acid Downpour, the Poison type Z-Move.

pok\u00e9doll.name: Poké Doll
pok\u00e9doll.effect: A doll that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

pok\u00e9toy.name: Poké Toy
pok\u00e9toy.effect: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

polka-dotbottle.name: Polka-Dot Bottle
polka-dotbottle.effect: A polka-dot-patterned bottle that’s small, light, and even comes with a cup. The detachable strap makes it handy for walking around with.

polka-dotcup.name: Polka-Dot Cup
polka-dotcup.effect: A cup for kids to use at picnics. It’s made of light but strong material. It’s stackable, which makes it handy for carrying around.

polka-dottablecloth.name: Polka-Dot Tablecloth
polka-dottablecloth.effect: A tablecloth with a fashionable polka-dot pattern. It’s great at repelling water and mold, and stains and smudges wipe right off.

pomegberry.name: Pomeg Berry
pomegberry.effect: Increases Friendship but lowers HP EVs.

potatosalad.name: Potato Salad
potatosalad.effect: This very tart ingredient—a soft salad that’s all about potatoes—pairs tremendously well with bread.

potatotortilla.name: Potato Tortilla
potatotortilla.effect: A very salty ingredient and a popular dish in Paldea. It’s undeniably filling.

poweranklet.name: Power Anklet
poweranklet.effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Speed gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

powerband.name: Power Band
powerband.effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Sp. Def gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

powerbelt.name: Power Belt
powerbelt.effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Defense gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

powerbracer.name: Power Bracer
powerbracer.effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Attack gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

powerherb.name: Power Herb
powerherb.effect: A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon. It allows the immediate use of a move that charges on the first turn.

powerlens.name: Power Lens
powerlens.effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Sp. Atk gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

powerplantpass.name: Power Plant Pass
powerplantpass.effect: This pass serves as an ID card for gaining access to the power plant that lies along Route 13.

powerweight.name: Power Weight
powerweight.effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes HP gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

ppmax.name: PP Max
ppmax.effect: Raises the maximum PP of a move to its maximum.

ppup.name: PP Up
ppup.effect: Raises the maximum PP of a move.

precookedburger.name: Precooked Burger
precookedburger.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. If you’re unsure about what to cook, you can’t go wrong with some burger.

premierball.name: Premier Ball
premierball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon; received after buying 10 Poké Balls.

prettyfeather.name: Pretty Feather
prettyfeather.effect: Can be sold for a high price.

primariumz.name: Primarium Z
primariumz.effect: Allows Primarina to upgrade Sparkling Aria to a Z-Move, Oceanic Operetta.

prismscale.name: Prism Scale
prismscale.effect: Evolves Feebas when traded holding the item.

prisonbottle.name: Prison Bottle
prisonbottle.effect: Transforms Hoopa Confined to Hoopa Unbound.

prof'sletter.name: Prof's Letter
prof'sletter.effect: A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote to your mother. A faint but pleasant perfume seems to cling to the paper.

prosciutto.name: Prosciutto
prosciutto.effect: This ingredient is very salty like regular ham, but the difference is prosciutto is not cooked after it is cured, giving it a fun freshness.

protectivepads.name: Protective Pads
protectivepads.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These pads protect the holder from effects caused by making direct contact with the target.

protector.name: Protector
protector.effect: Evolves Rhydon when traded holding the item.

psychicgem.name: Psychic Gem
psychicgem.effect: Increases the power of a Psychic-type move only once.

psychicmemory.name: Psychic Memory
psychicmemory.effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Psychic type.

psychicseed.name: Psychic Seed
psychicseed.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Psychic Terrain. It can only be used once.

psychicterashard.name: Psychic Tera Shard
psychicterashard.effect: Changes a Pokémon's Tera Type to Psychic.

psychiumz.name: Psychium Z
psychiumz.effect: Allows the use of Shattered Psyche, the Psychic type Z-Move.

psyduckdown.name: Psyduck Down
psyduckdown.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Psyduck, used in TM crafting.

punchingglove.name: Punching Glove
punchingglove.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This protective glove boosts the power of the holder’s punching moves and prevents direct contact with targets.

pungentroot.name: Pungent Root
pungentroot.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. Though carelessly picked, these herbs can add a fragrant accent to a dish.

pureincense.name: Pure Incense
pureincense.effect: Descreases the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon. Breeding Chimecho produces Chingling when held.

purplenectar.name: Purple Nectar
purplenectar.effect: A flower nectar obtained at Poni Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

qualotberry.name: Qualot Berry
qualotberry.effect: Increases Friendship but lowers Defense EVs.

quickball.name: Quick Ball
quickball.effect: Catches wild Pokémon with a higher rate (5x) on the first turn of a battle.

quickcandy.name: Quick Candy
quickcandy.effect: Increases a Pokémon's Speed stat by 1.

quickclaw.name: Quick Claw
quickclaw.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A light, sharp claw that lets the bearer move first occasionally.

quickpowder.name: Quick Powder
quickpowder.effect: Increases Speed when held by Ditto.

quietmint.name: Quiet Mint
quietmint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Quiet nature.

qwilfishspines.name: Qwilfish Spines
qwilfishspines.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Qwilfish, used in TM crafting.

rabutaberry.name: Rabuta Berry
rabutaberry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

rainbowslate.name: Rainbow Slate
rainbowslate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Rainbow Room at Ramanas Park.

raltsdust.name: Ralts Dust
raltsdust.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Ralts, used in TM crafting.

rarebone.name: Rare Bone
rarebone.effect: A bone that is extremely valuable for Pokémon archeology. It can be sold for a high price to shops.

rashmint.name: Rash Mint
rashmint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Rash nature.

rawstberry.name: Rawst Berry
rawstberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, it recovers from a burn.

razorclaw.name: Razor Claw
razorclaw.effect: Increases critical-hit ratio. Evolves Sneasel when held at night.

razorfang.name: Razor Fang
razorfang.effect: May cause opponent to flinch. Evolves Gligar when held at night.

razzberry.name: Razz Berry
razzberry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

reapercloth.name: Reaper Cloth
reapercloth.effect: Evolves Dusclops when traded holding the item.

redapricorn.name: Red Apricorn
redapricorn.effect: A red Apricorn. It assails your nostrils.

redbellpepper.name: Red Bell Pepper
redbellpepper.effect: An ingredient with some bitterness—but its bitter notes and overall flavor are pleasantly mild compared to its green cousin.

redcard.name: Red Card
redcard.effect: A card with a mysterious power. When the holder is struck by a foe, the attacker is removed from battle.

reddish.name: Red Dish
reddish.effect: A dish for picnics. Comes in plenty of colors to choose from based on the food or the mood. The red variety never fails to sell well.

redflute.name: Red Flute
redflute.effect: A toy flute made from red glass. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

rednectar.name: Red Nectar
rednectar.effect: A flower nectar obtained at Ula'ula Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

redonion.name: Red Onion
redonion.effect: An ingredient with some sweetness to it. Its spiciness and fragrance are milder than those of other onions, making it a pleasant bite.

redpok\u00e9ballpick.name: Red Poké Ball Pick
redpok\u00e9ballpick.effect: A sandwich pick with a simple red Poké Ball design. Often used by Trainers who picked a Fire-type Pokémon for their first partner.

redscarf.name: Red Scarf
redscarf.effect: Raises holder's Cool aspect in a Contest.

redshard.name: Red Shard
redshard.effect: A small red shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

red-flagpick.name: Red-Flag Pick
red-flagpick.effect: This pick flies a red flag that lends an air of adventure. The flag itself is made of card stock, so it’ll fly proudly even with no wind.

relaxedmint.name: Relaxed Mint
relaxedmint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Relaxed nature.

relicband.name: Relic Band
relicband.effect: A bracelet made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

reliccopper.name: Relic Copper
reliccopper.effect: A copper coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

reliccrown.name: Relic Crown
reliccrown.effect: A crown made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

relicgold.name: Relic Gold
relicgold.effect: A gold coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

relicsilver.name: Relic Silver
relicsilver.effect: A silver coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

relicstatue.name: Relic Statue
relicstatue.effect: A stone figure made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

relicvase.name: Relic Vase
relicvase.effect: A vase made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

rellormud.name: Rellor Mud
rellormud.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Rellor, used in TM crafting.

repeatball.name: Repeat Ball
repeatball.effect: Catches Pokémon already registered in the Pokédex with 3.5x the rate of a standard Poké Ball.

repel.name: Repel
repel.effect: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 100 steps after its use.

reseturge.name: Reset Urge
reseturge.effect: When used, it restores any stat changes of an ally Pokémon.

revealglass.name: Reveal Glass
revealglass.effect: A looking glass that reveals the truth. It's a mysterious glass that returns a Pokémon to its original shape.

revivalherb.name: Revival Herb
revivalherb.effect: Revives a Pokémon to max HP, but lowers Friendship.

revive.name: Revive
revive.effect: Revives a fainted Pokémon, restoring half its HP.

ribbonsweet.name: Ribbon Sweet
ribbonsweet.effect: Evolves Milcery into Ribbon Flavor Alcremie.

rice.name: Rice
rice.effect: An ingredient with a touch of sweetness. It’s unclear how well this cooked rice will serve as a sandwich filling.

rindoberry.name: Rindo Berry
rindoberry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Grass-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

ringtarget.name: Ring Target
ringtarget.effect: Moves that would otherwise have no effect will land on the Pokémon that holds it.

riolufur.name: Riolu Fur
riolufur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Riolu, used in TM crafting.

rockgem.name: Rock Gem
rockgem.effect: Increases the power of a Rock-type move only once.

rockincense.name: Rock Incense
rockincense.effect: Increases the power of Rock-type moves. Breeding Sudowoodo produces Bonsly when held.

rockmemory.name: Rock Memory
rockmemory.effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Rock type.

rockterashard.name: Rock Tera Shard
rockterashard.effect: Changes a Pokémon's Tera Type to Rock.

rockiumz.name: Rockium Z
rockiumz.effect: Allows the use of Continental Crush, the Rock type Z-Move.

rockruffrock.name: Rockruff Rock
rockruffrock.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Rockruff, used in TM crafting.

rockyhelmet.name: Rocky Helmet
rockyhelmet.effect: If the holder of this item takes damage, the attacker will also be damaged upon contact.

rollerskates.name: Roller Skates
rollerskates.effect: Attaches roller skates to the bottom of your shoes, allowing you to glide quickly around and perform tricks.

rolycolycoal.name: Rolycoly Coal
rolycolycoal.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Rolycoly, used in TM crafting.

rookideefeather.name: Rookidee Feather
rookideefeather.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Rookidee, used in TM crafting.

roomservice.name: Room Service
roomservice.effect: Lowers the Pokémon's speed during Trick Room.

rootfossil.name: Root Fossil
rootfossil.effect: A fossil of an ancient Pokémon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a plant root.

roseincense.name: Rose Incense
roseincense.effect: Increases the power of Grass-type moves. Breeding Roselia or Roserade produces Budew when held.

roseliberry.name: Roseli Berry
roseliberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the damage taken from one supereffective Fairy-type attack.

rotobargain.name: Roto Bargain
rotobargain.effect: Reduces the prices of products at Poké Marts by half.

rotoboost.name: Roto Boost
rotoboost.effect: Raises all stats of your battling Pokémon.

rotocatch.name: Roto Catch
rotocatch.effect: Increases the chance to catch Pokémon a lot.

rotoencounter.name: Roto Encounter
rotoencounter.effect: Increases the chance of encountering high-level wild Pokémon a lot for a certain period of time.

rotoexp.points.name: Roto Exp. Points
rotoexp.points.effect: Increases the Exp. Points your Pokémon receive after battle a little.

rotofriendship.name: Roto Friendship
rotofriendship.effect: Helps Pokémon in your party grow friendly faster.

rotohprestore.name: Roto HP Restore
rotohprestore.effect: Fully restores the HP of your battling Pokémon.

rotopprestore.name: Roto PP Restore
rotopprestore.effect: Fully restores the PP of your battling Pokémon.

rotoprizemoney.name: Roto Prize Money
rotoprizemoney.effect: Triples the prize money you receive after battle.

rotostealth.name: Roto Stealth
rotostealth.effect: Prevents you from encountering wild Pokémon for a certain period of time.

rotomphone.name: Rotom Phone
rotomphone.effect: The latest model of smartphone. A Pokémon called Rotom lives within it, and it can be used to run all sorts of handy apps.

rotomsparks.name: Rotom Sparks
rotomsparks.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Rotom, used in TM crafting.

rowapberry.name: Rowap Berry
rowapberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon and a special attack lands, the attacker also takes damage.

ruffletfeather.name: Rufflet Feather
ruffletfeather.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Rufflet, used in TM crafting.

sablenite.name: Sablenite
sablenite.effect: Enables Sableye to Mega Evolve during battle.

sableyegem.name: Sableye Gem
sableyegem.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Sableye, used in TM crafting.

sachet.name: Sachet
sachet.effect: Evolves Spritzee when traded holding the item.

sacredash.name: Sacred Ash
sacredash.effect: Revives all fainted Pokémon and fully restores their HP.

safariball.name: Safari Ball
safariball.effect: Catches Pokémon in the Safari Zone or Great Marsh.

safetygoggles.name: Safety Goggles
safetygoggles.effect: Prevents damage from weather and powder.

salacberry.name: Salac Berry
salacberry.effect: Raises Speed when HP is low.

saladmix.name: Salad Mix
saladmix.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. The assortment of vegetables looks quite appealing and healthy.

salamencite.name: Salamencite
salamencite.effect: Enables Salamence to Mega Evolve during battle.

salanditgas.name: Salandit Gas
salanditgas.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Salandit, used in TM crafting.

salt.name: Salt
salt.effect: A very salty seasoning, unsurprisingly. People quite like the grains of salt that can be gathered from the footprints of particularly jagged Naclstack.

saltyherbamystica.name: Salty Herba Mystica
saltyherbamystica.effect: One of the condiments spoken of as legends. Its mellow saltiness is said to be tremendously effective when it comes to promoting health.

sandileclaw.name: Sandile Claw
sandileclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Sandile, used in TM crafting.

sandwich.name: Sandwich
sandwich.effect: A dish made by sandwiching vegetables, meat, or other ingredients between two pieces of bread. It makes a fantastic meal when out on a picnic.

sandygastsand.name: Sandygast Sand
sandygastsand.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Sandygast, used in TM crafting.

sassymint.name: Sassy Mint
sassymint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Sassy nature.

sausages.name: Sausages
sausages.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. These sausages should be boiled before eating.

scarletbook.name: Scarlet Book
scarletbook.effect: A record of the expedition that the author, Heath, went on within the Great Crater of Paldea. The book has the name “Sada” written on it in clumsy handwriting.

scatterbugpowder.name: Scatterbug Powder
scatterbugpowder.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Scatterbug, used in TM crafting.

sceptilite.name: Sceptilite
sceptilite.effect: Enables Sceptile to Mega Evolve during battle.

scizorite.name: Scizorite
scizorite.effect: Enables Scizor to Mega Evolve during battle.

scrollofdarkness.name: Scroll of Darkness
scrollofdarkness.effect: A peculiar scroll that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. Written upon it are the true secrets of the path of darkness.

scrollofwaters.name: Scroll of Waters
scrollofwaters.effect: A peculiar scroll that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. Written upon it are the true secrets of the path of water.

scytherclaw.name: Scyther Claw
scytherclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Scyther, used in TM crafting.

seaincense.name: Sea Incense
seaincense.effect: Increases the power of Water-type moves. Breeding Marill or Azumarill produces Azurill when held.

seriousmint.name: Serious Mint
seriousmint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match a neutral nature.

seviperfang.name: Seviper Fang
seviperfang.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Seviper, used in TM crafting.

shaderootcarrot.name: Shaderoot Carrot
shaderootcarrot.effect: Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved steed likes to eat. It grew in a gloomy field.

sharpbeak.name: Sharp Beak
sharpbeak.effect: Increases the power of Flying-type moves.

sharpedonite.name: Sharpedonite
sharpedonite.effect: Enables Sharpedo to Mega Evolve during battle.

shedshell.name: Shed Shell
shedshell.effect: A tough, discarded carapace to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to switch with a waiting Pokémon in battle.

shellbell.name: Shell Bell
shellbell.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's HP is restored a little every time it inflicts damage.

shellderpearl.name: Shellder Pearl
shellderpearl.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Shellder, used in TM crafting.

shellosmucus.name: Shellos Mucus
shellosmucus.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Shellos, used in TM crafting.

shinxfang.name: Shinx Fang
shinxfang.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Shinx, used in TM crafting.

shinycharm.name: Shiny Charm
shinycharm.effect: A shiny charm said to increase the chance of finding a Shiny Pokémon in the wild.

shoalsalt.name: Shoal Salt
shoalsalt.effect: Pure salt that can be discovered deep inside the Shoal Cave. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

shoalshell.name: Shoal Shell
shoalshell.effect: A pretty seashell that can be found deep inside the Shoal Cave. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

shockdrive.name: Shock Drive
shockdrive.effect: Changes Techno Blast to an Electric-type move when held by Genesect.

shroodleink.name: Shroodle Ink
shroodleink.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Shroodle, used in TM crafting.

shroomishspores.name: Shroomish Spores
shroomishspores.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Shroomish, used in TM crafting.

shucaberry.name: Shuca Berry
shucaberry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Ground-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

shuppetscrap.name: Shuppet Scrap
shuppetscrap.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Shuppet, used in TM crafting.

silicobrasand.name: Silicobra Sand
silicobrasand.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Silicobra, used in TM crafting.

silkscarf.name: Silk Scarf
silkscarf.effect: Increases the power of Normal-type moves.

silverbottle.name: Silver Bottle
silverbottle.effect: A popular option among hikers. It’s made with titanium, so it doesn’t rust even if it’s used to hold drinks with high sodium content.

silvercup.name: Silver Cup
silvercup.effect: A popular option among hikers. It’s made with titanium, so it doesn’t rust even if it’s used to hold drinks with high sodium content.

silvernanabberry.name: Silver Nanab Berry
silvernanabberry.effect: Greatly calms a Pokémon in battle, in Let's Go Pikachu/Eevee.

silverpick.name: Silver Pick
silverpick.effect: A silver pick that oozes class. Using it on a sandwich lends an extravagant air that’ll make you want to eat up, even if you don’t love the fillings.

silverpinapberry.name: Silver Pinap Berry
silverpinapberry.effect: Greatly increases chance of getting items when a Pokémon is caught, in Pokémon Let's Go.

silverpowder.name: Silver Powder
silverpowder.effect: Increases the power of Bug-type moves.

silverrazzberry.name: Silver Razz Berry
silverrazzberry.effect: Makes a Pokémon easier to catch in Pokémon Let's Go.

sinisteachip.name: Sinistea Chip
sinisteachip.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Sinistea, used in TM crafting.

sitrusberry.name: Sitrus Berry
sitrusberry.effect: If held by a Pokémon, it heals the user's HP a little.

skiddoleaf.name: Skiddo Leaf
skiddoleaf.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Skiddo, used in TM crafting.

skrelpkelp.name: Skrelp Kelp
skrelpkelp.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Skrelp, used in TM crafting.

skullfossil.name: Skull Fossil
skullfossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that lived on the land. It appears to be part of a head.

skwovetfur.name: Skwovet Fur
skwovetfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Skwovet, used in TM crafting.

skyplate.name: Sky Plate
skyplate.effect: Increases power of Flying-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Flying.

slakothfur.name: Slakoth Fur
slakothfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Slakoth, used in TM crafting.

slowbronite.name: Slowbronite
slowbronite.effect: Enables Slowbro to Mega Evolve during battle.

slowpokeclaw.name: Slowpoke Claw
slowpokeclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Slowpoke, used in TM crafting.

slowpokecup.name: Slowpoke Cup
slowpokecup.effect: A cup for big-time Pokémon fans. Kids will happily drink out of it, making it a boon to parents.

smartcandy.name: Smart Candy
smartcandy.effect: Increases a Pokémon's Special Attack stat by 1.

smartcandyl.name: Smart Candy L
smartcandyl.effect: Increases a Pokémon's Special Attack stat.

smartcandyxl.name: Smart Candy XL
smartcandyxl.effect: Increases a Pokémon's Special Attack stat.

smilingveepick.name: Smiling Vee Pick
smilingveepick.effect: A pick designed after Eevee, sporting the Pokémon’s smiling face. It’s easy to grab by the ears, which is part of why it’s so popular.

smokeball.name: Smoke Ball
smokeball.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to flee from any wild Pokémon without fail.

smoke-poketail.name: Smoke-Poke Tail
smoke-poketail.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. When a Slowpoke’s tail falls off, it grows back quickly.

smokedfillet.name: Smoked Fillet
smokedfillet.effect: A very salty and bitter ingredient with that unmistakable smoky flavor. It pairs exceptionally well with veggies.

smolivoil.name: Smoliv Oil
smolivoil.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Smoliv, used in TM crafting.

smoothrock.name: Smooth Rock
smoothrock.effect: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Sandstorm used by the holder.

sneaselclaw.name: Sneasel Claw
sneaselclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Sneasel, used in TM crafting.

snomthread.name: Snom Thread
snomthread.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Snom, used in TM crafting.

snorliumz.name: Snorlium Z
snorliumz.effect: Allows Snorlax to upgrade Giga Impact to a Z-Move, Pulverizing Pancake.

snoruntfur.name: Snorunt Fur
snoruntfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Snorunt, used in TM crafting.

snoverberries.name: Snover Berries
snoverberries.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Snover, used in TM crafting.

snowball.name: Snowball
snowball.effect: Raises Attack if hit by an Ice-type move.

softsand.name: Soft Sand
softsand.effect: Increases the power of Ground-type moves.

solganiumz.name: Solganium Z
solganiumz.effect: Allows Solgaleo to upgrade Sunsteel Strike to a Z-Move, Searing Sunraze Smash.

soothebell.name: Soothe Bell
soothebell.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a bell with a comforting chime that calms the holder and makes it friendly.

souldew.name: Soul Dew
souldew.effect: Increases the power of Psychic- and Dragon-type moves when held by Latios or Latias. Increases Sp.Atk/Sp.Def prior to Gen 7.

soulslate.name: Soul Slate
soulslate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Soul Room at Ramanas Park.

sourherbamystica.name: Sour Herba Mystica
sourherbamystica.effect: This surpassingly sour condiment is said to be super effective in helping the eater recover from exhaustion. Only a scant few people know it exists.

spelltag.name: Spell Tag
spelltag.effect: Increases the power of Ghost-type moves.

spelonberry.name: Spelon Berry
spelonberry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

spicemix.name: Spice Mix
spicemix.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. There are over fifty spices contained within this ingredient’s hot flavor.

spicyherbamystica.name: Spicy Herba Mystica
spicyherbamystica.effect: The legendary condiment said to have the mightiest of all spicy flavors. It’s said that a single bite will kick the metabolism into high gear immediately.

spiritombfragment.name: Spiritomb Fragment
spiritombfragment.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Spiritomb, used in TM crafting.

splashplate.name: Splash Plate
splashplate.effect: Increases power of Water-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Water.

spoinkpearl.name: Spoink Pearl
spoinkpearl.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Spoink, used in TM crafting.

spookyplate.name: Spooky Plate
spookyplate.effect: Increases power of Ghost-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Ghost.

spookytablecloth.name: Spooky Tablecloth
spookytablecloth.effect: A pop-art-style tablecloth with Pokémon faces floating up from the deep nighttime blue. This is a must-have for fans of Ghost types.

sportball.name: Sport Ball
sportball.effect: A special Poké Ball for the Bug-Catching Contest.

sprinklotad.name: Sprinklotad
sprinklotad.effect: A watering can shaped like a Lotad. It helps promote the healthy growth of any Berries planted in good, soft soil.

squallslate.name: Squall Slate
squallslate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Squall Room at Ramanas Park.

squawkabillyfeather.name: Squawkabilly Feather
squawkabillyfeather.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Squawkabilly, used in TM crafting.

stablemulch.name: Stable Mulch
stablemulch.effect: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

stantlerhair.name: Stantler Hair
stantlerhair.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Stantler, used in TM crafting.

starpiece.name: Star Piece
starpiece.effect: A shard of a pretty gem that sparkles in a red color. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

starsweet.name: Star Sweet
starsweet.effect: Evolves Milcery into Star Flavor Alcremie.

stardust.name: Stardust
stardust.effect: Lovely, red-colored sand with a loose, silky feel. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

starfberry.name: Starf Berry
starfberry.effect: Sharply raises a random stat when HP is low.

starlyfeather.name: Starly Feather
starlyfeather.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Starly, used in TM crafting.

steelbottle(b).name: Steel Bottle (B)
steelbottle(b).effect: A go-to bottle sometimes used while camping. The stainless steel keeps the temperature inside steady, making it great for keeping drinks hot or cold.

steelbottle(r).name: Steel Bottle (R)
steelbottle(r).effect: A go-to bottle sometimes used while camping. The stainless steel keeps the temperature inside steady, making it great for keeping drinks hot or cold.

steelbottle(y).name: Steel Bottle (Y)
steelbottle(y).effect: A go-to bottle sometimes used while camping. The stainless steel keeps the temperature inside steady, making it great for keeping drinks hot or cold.

steelgem.name: Steel Gem
steelgem.effect: Increases the power of a Steel-type move only once.

steelmemory.name: Steel Memory
steelmemory.effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Steel type.

steelterashard.name: Steel Tera Shard
steelterashard.effect: Changes a Pokémon's Tera Type to Steel.

steeliumz.name: Steelium Z
steeliumz.effect: Allows the use of Corkscrew Crash, the Steel type Z-Move.

steelixite.name: Steelixite
steelixite.effect: Enables Steelix to Mega Evolve during battle.

stickybarb.name: Sticky Barb
stickybarb.effect: A held item that damages the holder on every turn. It may latch on to foes and allies that touch the holder.

stoneplate.name: Stone Plate
stoneplate.effect: Increases power of Rock-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Rock.

stonjournerstone.name: Stonjourner Stone
stonjournerstone.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Stonjourner, used in TM crafting.

strangesouvenir.name: Strange Souvenir
strangesouvenir.effect: An ornament depicting a Pokémon that is venerated as a protector in some region far from Kalos.

stratosphericslate.name: Stratospheric Slate
stratosphericslate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Stratospheric Room at Ramanas Park.

strawberry.name: Strawberry
strawberry.effect: A very tart and sweet ingredient, popular for its ability to make a sandwich visually striking.

strawberrysweet.name: Strawberry Sweet
strawberrysweet.effect: Evolves Milcery into Strawberry Flavor Alcremie.

stripedbottle.name: Striped Bottle
stripedbottle.effect: A striped bottle that’s small, light, and even comes with a cup. The detachable strap makes it handy for walking around with.

stripedcup.name: Striped Cup
stripedcup.effect: A cup for kids to use at picnics. It’s made of light but strong material. It’s stackable, which makes it handy for carrying around.

stripedtablecloth.name: Striped Tablecloth
stripedtablecloth.effect: A tablecloth with a fashionable striped pattern. It’s great at repelling water and mold, and stains and smudges wipe right off.

stunkyfur.name: Stunky Fur
stunkyfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Stunky, used in TM crafting.

sunkernleaf.name: Sunkern Leaf
sunkernleaf.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Sunkern, used in TM crafting.

sunriseflowerpick.name: Sunrise Flower Pick
sunriseflowerpick.effect: A flower pick designed to evoke a glorious sunrise. It’s part of a line of “sky-flower” picks. Using a few is guaranteed to boost that special picnic spirit.

sunsetflowerpick.name: Sunset Flower Pick
sunsetflowerpick.effect: A flower pick designed to evoke a blazing sunset. It’s part of a line of “sky-flower” picks. Using a few is guaranteed to boost that special picnic spirit.

superrepel.name: Super Repel
superrepel.effect: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 200 steps after its use.

surskitsyrup.name: Surskit Syrup
surskitsyrup.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Surskit, used in TM crafting.

swablufluff.name: Swablu Fluff
swablufluff.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Swablu, used in TM crafting.

swampertite.name: Swampertite
swampertite.effect: Enables Swampert to Mega Evolve during battle.

sweetheart.name: Sweet Heart
sweetheart.effect: Very sweet chocolate. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by only 20 points.

sweetherbamystica.name: Sweet Herba Mystica
sweetherbamystica.effect: A legendary condiment told of only in books. Word has it that one taste of its sweet flavor stimulates the digestive system and cures a lack of appetite.

tadbulbmucus.name: Tadbulb Mucus
tadbulbmucus.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Tadbulb, used in TM crafting.

tamatoberry.name: Tamato Berry
tamatoberry.effect: Increases Friendship but lowers Speed EVs.

tandemausfur.name: Tandemaus Fur
tandemausfur.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Tandemaus, used in TM crafting.

tangaberry.name: Tanga Berry
tangaberry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Bug-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

tapuniumz.name: Tapunium Z
tapuniumz.effect: Allows the Tapus to upgrade Nature's Madness to a Z-Move, Guardian of Alola.

tarountulathread.name: Tarountula Thread
tarountulathread.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Tarountula, used in TM crafting.

tatsugiriscales.name: Tatsugiri Scales
tatsugiriscales.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Tatsugiri, used in TM crafting.

tauroshair.name: Tauros Hair
tauroshair.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Tauros, used in TM crafting.

tectonicslate.name: Tectonic Slate
tectonicslate.effect: A slate overflowing with enigmatic energy. You can feel a strong connection between it and the Tectonic Room at Ramanas Park.

teddiursaclaw.name: Teddiursa Claw
teddiursaclaw.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Teddiursa, used in TM crafting.

teraorb.name: Tera Orb
teraorb.effect: An orb that holds within it the power to crystallize. When it is charged with energy, it can be used to cause Pokémon to Terastallize.

terrainextender.name: Terrain Extender
terrainextender.effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the terrain caused by the holder's move or Ability.

thickclub.name: Thick Club
thickclub.effect: Increases Attack when held by Cubone or Marowak.

throatspray.name: Throat Spray
throatspray.effect: Raises Sp. Atk when a sound-based move is used.

timerball.name: Timer Ball
timerball.effect: Catches Pokémon with a higher rate the more turns have occurred (up to 4x).

timidmint.name: Timid Mint
timidmint.effect: Changes the Pokémon's stats to match the Timid nature.

tinofbeans.name: Tin of Beans
tinofbeans.effect: One of the many ingredients that can be used for cooking at your camp. When simmered, the beans suffuse a dish with their mild flavor.

tinkatinkhair.name: Tinkatink Hair
tinkatinkhair.effect: Material obtained after defeating/catching Tinkatink, used in TM crafting.

tinybambooshoot.name: Tiny Bamboo Shoot
tinybambooshoot.effect: A small and rare bamboo shoot. It’s quite popular with a certain class of gourmands.

heavydutyboots.name: Heavy-Duty Boots
heavydutyboots.effect: Heavy-Duty Boots protect the user from the effects of traps set on the battlefield, such as Spikes or Stealth Rock.

toxicorb.name: Toxic Orb
toxicorb.effect: It's a bizarre orb that exudes toxins when touched and will badly poison the holder during battle.

watermemory.name: Water Memory
watermemory.effect: An item that changes the types of Silvally and its Multi-Attack to Water-type.

weaknesspolicy.name: Weakness Policy
weaknesspolicy.effect: A held item that increases your attack each time you receive damage.

whiteherb.name: White Herb
whiteherb.effect: An item that restores any lowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

widelens.name: Wide Lens
widelens.effect: It's a magnifying lens that slightly boosts the accuracy of the holder's moves.
